headline: Strategy, Bitcoin Slide Ahead Of Today's Defining Test
summary: Strategy shares slid along with the bitcoin price on Friday ahead of a possibly key announcement for the bitcoin-holding company late this afternoon.  The Nasdaq is set to reveal annual changes to the Nasdaq 100 index, whose performance is tracked by the Invesco QQQ Trust, which has over $400 billion invested.  The reconstitution of the index comes as MSCI considers whether to exclude companies whose primary business is acquiring bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies, which would mean ousting MSTR stock from its indices.

The reconstitution of the index comes as MSCI considers whether to exclude companies whose primary business is acquiring bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies, which would mean ousting MSTR stock from its indices.

headline: Broadcom & Lululemon earnings, what AI means for Fed's inflation goals
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman takes a look at several of the day's developing stories on December 12, 2025. Yahoo Finance senior reporters Brooke DiPalma and Dan Howley join the program to discuss Lululemon's (LULU) latest CEO search and Broadcom's (AVGO) stock reaction to the chip company's fiscal fourth quarter earnings results. F/m Investments CEO & CIO Alex Morris discusses how the Federal Reserve is viewing AI's impact on labor productivity and whether demand for artificial intelligence and data center buildouts could contribute to deflation. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

F/m Investments CEO & CIO Alex Morris discusses how the Federal Reserve is viewing AI's impact on labor productivity and whether demand for artificial intelligence and data center buildouts could contribute to deflation. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Nasdaq Futures Drop With AI Fears Center Stage for Markets. Dow Rises.
summary: Futures tracking the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 106 points, or 0.2%, while contracts tied to the S&P 500 were falling 0.2%, after both indexes rebounded to hit record closing highs on Thursday.  Nasdaq 100 futures were dropping 0.5%.  The gauges were probably moving in different directions because of Broadcom, which is in the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 but not the Dow.

headline: Goldman’s Snider Sees AI, Strong Macro Driving 12% Earnings Jump
summary: The team led by Ben Snider expects earnings-per-share at S&P 500 companies to jump 12% next year and 10% in 2027.  Of that, AI-driven productivity gains will contribute about 0.4% and 1.5%, respectively.  Snider, who is replacing David Kostin as chief US equity strategist at the end of the year, reiterated his target for the S&P 500 to trade around 7,600 points next year, implying gains of 10% from current levels.

headline: Broadcom Reports Strong AI Revenue Surge but Shares Drop on Guidance Warning

The company beat on both revenue and earnings after the bell, and CEO Hock Tan delivered the kind of forward commentary investors wanted to hear. Yet shares tumbled as much as 9% in after-hours ... headline: Broadcom Shares Slide After Investors Seek Bigger AI Payoff
summary: The shares fell about 5% after hours on Thursday, reversing earlier gains, following unsettling commentary from Chief Executive Officer Hock Tan on a conference call with analysts.  The conference call followed a dizzying run-up in Broadcom shares, and investors were seeking more clarity on when and how the company will get a payoff from AI.  Broadcom also held off on giving an annual AI revenue forecast, with Tan saying it was “a moving target.”

raw.headline: Broadcom Shares Slide After Investors Seek Bigger AI Payoff

Broadcom also held off on giving an annual AI revenue forecast, with Tan saying it was “a moving target.”
